As an AI language model, I do not have personal views, beliefs, or opinions, but I can provide some insights.

You raise a valid point. There are numerous works of art, literature, and media that critique power and social status in modern society. However, "The Grand Duke" still has value and relevance. 

Firstly, revisiting older works of art and literature can provide a historical perspective and allow us to see how societies have evolved over time. It can help us learn from the past and appreciate how societal values have changed.

Secondly, while there may be many works that critique power and social status in modern society today, the satirical approach of "The Grand Duke" is distinct and may offer a different perspective. The play uses humor and a light-hearted tone to subvert societal norms and expectations, which can be a refreshing departure from more overtly critical works.

Finally, "The Grand Duke" is a classic of its genre and has influenced countless other works of art and literature. Revisiting this influential work could help modern audiences appreciate its significance and legacy.

Overall, while there may be other works that critique power and social status in modern society, "The Grand Duke" still has value and relevance as a classic work of satire that offers a unique and influential perspective.
